references.paper_title: Parallel diffusion models of operator and image for blind inverse problems
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it directly addresses blind image restoration using diffusion models, a core topic of the current paper, and proposes a parallel diffusion model approach.

This paper introduces DDIM, a crucial component of the BIRD method, providing an efficient and deterministic way to sample from a pre-trained diffusion model, which is essential for the proposed approach.
This foundational paper introduces DDPMs, laying the theoretical groundwork for diffusion models used in image generation and restoration, which is directly built upon in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Imagenet: A large-scale hierarchical image database
references.reason: This paper introduces the ImageNet dataset, a benchmark used extensively in image restoration and deep learning research, providing the basis for comparative evaluation of the BIRD method.

references.paper_title: The unreasonable effectiveness of deep features as a perceptual metric
references.reason: This paper introduces LPIPS, a perceptual image quality metric, which is used for evaluation in the current paper to assess the visual quality of restored images.
